seo_keywords: Roborock S8 Pro Ultra mop not washing

problems.title: Dock Not Washing Mop / Water Error
problems.description: The dock fails to wash the mop or reports empty clean water tank when full.
possible_causes: Dirty water tank seal is loose
Water filter in the dock is clogged
solution_steps: Check the rubber seals on both water tanks.
Remove the high-speed maintenance brush in the base and clean it.
Clean the water filter mesh at the bottom of the dock.

required_parts.name: S8 Pro Ultra Maintenance Brush
required_parts.search_query: Roborock S8 Pro Ultra Dock Brush

problems.title: Main Brush Jammed Error
problems.description: Robot stops and reports DuoRoller jam.
possible_causes: Hair wrapped around the ends of the dual rollers
solution_steps: Twist off the removable caps at the ends to remove hair rings.

faqs.question: Is it worth fixing the issue on a S8 Pro Ultra Robot Vacuum?
faqs.answer: Yes. A replacement part typically costs significantly less than a new $468 vacuum, and extending the life of your Roborock is eco-friendly.

faqs.question: How do I know if my S8 Pro Ultra Robot Vacuum needs a new part?
faqs.answer: Common signs include reduced performance and the device failing to complete a cleaning cycle.

faqs.question: Can I replace the part on my S8 Pro Ultra Robot Vacuum myself?
faqs.answer: Yes, this is a user-serviceable repair. Most replacements generally require just a screwdriver and about 10-20 minutes of time.
